  • Method Details

    • addProject

      public String addProject(String projectName, String clientName, Calendar expectedStartDate, Calendar expectedEndDate, double budget)
      This function adds a new project to the projects array.
      Parameters:
      projectName - The name of the project.
      clientName - The name of the client.
      expectedStartDate - The date that the project is expected to start.
      expectedEndDate - The date the project is expected to end.
      budget - The budget of the project.

    • initStages

      public String initStages(String projectName, Calendar expectedStartDate, Calendar realStartDate, int firstStageMonths) throws Exception
      This function initializes stages for a project with given start dates and adds them to the project's list of stages.
      Parameters:
      projectName - a String representing the name of the project
      expectedStartDate - The expected start date for the first stage of the project.
      realStartDate - The actual start date of a project stage.
      firstStageMonths - The months that requires de first stage.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • addCapsule

      public String addCapsule(String projectName, int type, String capsuleId, String capsuleDescription, String capsuleWorkerName, String capsuleWorkerCharge, String capsuleLection, String capsuleHashtags)
      This function adds a capsule to the current stage of a project
      Parameters:
      projectName - The name of the project
      type - An int representing the type of the capsule.
      capsuleId - The id of the capsule
      capsuleDescription - A description of the capsule.
      capsuleWorkerName - The name of the worker who is assigned to the capsule.
      capsuleWorkerCharge - The charge of the worker in the capsule
      capsuleLection - The lection of the capsule.
      capsuleHashtags - The hashtags asociated with the capsule.

    • approveCapsule

      public String approveCapsule(String projectName, String capsuleId, Calendar approveDate, boolean newStatus)
      The function receives a project name, a capsule id, a publish date and a new status. It checks if the project exists, if it does, it checks if the stage is active, if it is, it checks if the capsule exists, if it does, it checks if the new status is true, if it is, it changes the status of the capsule to true and sets the publish date to the one received as a parameter. If the new status is false, it returns a message saying that the status hasn't changed
      Parameters:
      projectName - The name of the project
      capsuleId - The id of the capsule to be approved.
      approveDate - The date the capsule wash published.
      newStatus - The new approved status of the capsule.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String.

    • publishCapsule

      public String publishCapsule(String projectName, String capsuleId, boolean newPublishedStatus)
      This function is used to publish a capsule that is approved and not published yet
      Parameters:
      projectName - The name of the project that the capsule is in.
      capsuleId - The id of the capsule to be published.
      newPublishedStatus - true or false
      Returns:
      A string.

    • finishStage

      public String finishStage(String projectName, Calendar endDate)
      This function deactivates the current stage of a project and activates the next stage if it exists, and sets the real end date of the current stage.
      Parameters:
      projectName - a String variable representing the name of the project to finish a stage for.
      endDate - A Calendar object representing the date on which the current stage of a project is finished.
      Returns:
      A String message indicating that the current stage has been deactivated and the next stage has been activated.

    • setStartDates

      public void setStartDates(String projectName)
      This function sets the real and expected start dates for a stage in a project based on the end date of the previous stage.
      Parameters:
      projectName - a String representing the name of the project for which the start dates of stages need to be set.

    • setEndDates

      public void setEndDates(String projectName, int amountMonths)
      This function sets the expected end dates for a project's stages based on the given project name and amount of months.
      Parameters:
      projectName - A String representing the name of the project for which the end dates of stages need to be set.
      amountMonths - The number of months to add to the expected end date of a stage in a project.

    • showCapsulesByType

      public String showCapsulesByType()
      The function returns a message displaying the amount of capsules for each type.
      Returns:
      A string message that shows the amount of capsules for each type (technical, management, domain, and experiences).

    • showCapsulesLections

      public String showCapsulesLections(String projectName, int stagesPos)
      This function returns a string containing the lections of capsules in a specific stage of a project, given the project name and stage position.
      Parameters:
      projectName - A String representing the name of the project for which the capsules' lections are to be shown.
      stagesPos - The position of the stage in the array of stages for a specific project.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that contains the lections of the capsules in a specific stage of a project. If the project is not found, the message will indicate that there are no registered projects.

    • searchCapsulesByWorker

      public String searchCapsulesByWorker(String workerName)
      This function searches for capsules registered by a specific worker and returns a message indicating whether or not the worker has registered any capsules.
      Parameters:
      workerName - A String representing the name of the worker whose capsules need to be searched.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message indicating whether or not a worker has registered capsules in the projects. The message will either say "Yes, the worker [workerName] has registered capsules" or "No, the worker [workerName] hasn't registered capsules".

    • searchProjectWithMoreCapsules

      public String searchProjectWithMoreCapsules()
      This function searches for the project with the highest number of capsules and returns a message with the project name and number of capsules.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that indicates the project with the highest number of capsules. If there are no projects in the array, the message will indicate that it did not enter the loop.

    • searchLectionByHashtag

      public String searchLectionByHashtag(String hashtag)
      The function searches for a specific hashtag in all published capsules and returns the corresponding lecture.
      Parameters:
      hashtag - A string representing the hashtag to search for in the lections.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that contains all the lections that have the specified hashtag and are approved and published.

    • getFirstValidPosition

      public int getFirstValidPosition()
      > This function returns the first valid position in the array.
      Returns:
      The first valid position in the array.
